title: This Is Us star Chrissy Metz speaks on her character's overeating habit
text:
This Is Us star Chrissy Metz has detailed her own struggles with overeating after her character on the hit drama show tackled similar problems during a recent episode.

The 39-year-old actress plays Kate Pearson on This Is Us, a character who just gave birth to her first child and has consistently battled issues with her own body image and weight throughout the series.

When speaking to People about her character's current storyline, Chrissy confessed she resonated personally with Kate's body struggles and why she turned to overeating to cope.

Connection: Chrissy Metz, 39, plays Kate Pearson on This Is Us, a character whose storyline highlights her struggles with weight and body image

Tapping in: In a recent episode, Kate turned to overeating to cope with her current stress. Chrissy (pictured in September) said she resonated with the storyline

'It’s one of those things that of course I can relate to because I have those voids with validation from other people or with food or whatever I think is going to make me feel better,' Chrissy told the publication.

'Everybody, to some degree, fills a void with something, whether it’s social media, alcohol, drugs, overspending, overeating. We’re either chasing a feeling or trying to get rid of a feeling.'

Earlier this season, her character discovered her newborn son was blind and decided to use food to cope with the problem. This method was previously used by the character when coping with the death of her father, played by Milo Ventimiglia.

But Chrissy said handling troubles with overeating would not solve her character's personal problems, and she knew that from personal experience.

'But in the long run it never does. It’s just a Bandaid on a really big wound that you have to get to the bottom of, because we don’t like to be uncomfortable as humans. It feels awful, and that’s sort of what she’s doing with her overeating,' she said.

This conversation inspired Chrissy to reflect on her personal life.

She shared: 'That’s a real big challenge, and of course, I get that and I understand that personally. Of course, I bring that [into playing Kate]. I think every actor brings something personal to a role.'

Difficult topic: 'That’s a real big challenge, and of course, I get that and I understand that personally,' Chrissy said about Kate's character struggles

Positive influence: Chrissy has previously said she doesn't want Kate's storyline to be solely focused on her weight. But she has also used her platform to help others with body postivity

Having a platform on a hit show like This Is Us has allowed Chrissy to speak on topics relating to body positivity and acceptance.

Fans previously have tweeted personally to the actress and commended her for the perspective she takes with Kate when acting out the character's body struggles.

During the episode last week, one fan commended Chrissy character's courage and bravery.

'Chrissy I wish I had your courage. I live the booth nightmare. There are days I have wished myself get hit by a bus rather than deal w the embarrassment horrible people have done to me over it,' the fan wrote.

To this, Chrissy responded: 'Your weight does not define you! People’s perceptions are theirs. You are worthy and purposeful no matter what.'

Although Chrissy has embraced speaking about body image with both her personal life and playing Kate, she also has voiced frustration that the character's story, as well as her own, is centered on weight.

'It can be frustrating in that the weight is not all that I am or all that Kate is, but it’s a really big part of who we’ve allowed it to be,' she told Vanity Fair in 2017. 'And the only way to tell that story is to tell the story.'
description: Chrissy, 39, plays Kate Pearson on This Is Us, a character whose storyline highlights her struggles with weight and body image. In a recent episode, Kate turned to overeating to cope.
